news_header: Three journalists were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a building housing reporters in Lebanon, prompting accusations of a deliberate attack on the press.
news_text: An Israeli airstrike targeted a guesthouse in Hasbaya, southeastern Lebanon, killing three journalists from Al-Manar TV and Al Mayadeen TV. The attack, described as a 'war crime' by Lebanon's information minister, occurred in a compound known to house journalists, with vehicles marked 'press' visible. The strike injured three others and followed a series of escalating airstrikes in Lebanon amid ongoing conflict with Hezbollah. The Lebanese government accused Israel of intentionally targeting the journalists, while the Israeli military has not commented. The incident highlights the dangers faced by media personnel in conflict zones.
